channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: NPR news chief announces she's leaving days after Congress kills federal funding
item.description: NPR newsroom chief Edith Chapin says she's leaving the network. She made the announcement just days after Congress voted to strip public broadcasting ...

item.title: Hurry up! Scientists predict today will be (slightly) shorter than normal
item.description: Earth doesn't rotate exactly on schedule. Scientists believe that today is going to be about a millisecond short of a typical 24-hour day.

item.title: Coca-Cola says it will use U.S. cane sugar in a new Coke, a plan pushed by Trump
item.description: Coca-Cola's move comes a week after President Trump said he had been talking to the soft drink giant about using cane sugar rather than high-fructose ...

item.title: Have all girls or all boys? Study suggests the odds aren't 50/50
item.description: A study analyzed decades of births and found that larger families showed a distinct tendency toward all girls or all boys, rather than a mix.

item.title: 2 military bases expand to detain immigrants. And, Israel advances into central Gaza
item.description: Two U.S. military bases are expanding to detain immigrants suspected of being in the country without legal status. And, Israel has advanced into Centr...

item.title: A double organ donor and a teen innovator find purpose through giving
item.description: David Begnaud shares the stories of Brian Flynn, a rare double organ donor, and Rachel Bee, a teen who created a sweatshirt to help fellow patients.

item.title: How automakers are being affected by Trump's tariffs
item.description: A 25% tariff on vehicles and auto parts imported into the U.S. has hit automakers amid President Trump's push for global trade partners to reach deals...

item.title: Lawyers for Kilmar Abrego Garcia request delayed jail release amid deportation threat
item.description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia's lawyers have requested that a judge delay his jail release for 30 days amid the threat of deportation once he's released. CBS N...

item.title: Is there a grace period on credit card payments?
item.description: Think you have extra time to pay your credit card? You might — but that's not true in every case. Here's why.

item.title: China blocks U.S. government worker and banker from leaving the country
item.description: China is refusing to let a U.S. Department of Commerce employee and a Wells Fargo banker leave the country, officials say.

item.title: Brazilian Supreme Court justice threatens to arrest Bolsonaro
item.description: Judge Moraes accuses Bolsonaro of breaching a social media ban he had imposed on the ex-president.

item.title: DR Congo rescuers dig with bare hands for trapped miners
item.description: Six people have been pulled out alive, with one seriously injured, since shafts collapsed on Sunday.

item.title: French cities impose curfews on children after drug violence
item.description: Local authorities have adopted the measures following a series of violent incidents, including shootings.

item.title: Things to know about the release of federal documents related to MLK’s assassination
item.description: Federal records related to the investigation into the assassination of the Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. have been released.

item.title: Trump administration releases files on Martin Luther King Jr
item.description: About 230,000 pages of records are unsealed, despite opposition from some of the King family.

item.title: Hunter Biden lashes out at George Clooney over father's 2024 election exit
item.description: Joe Biden's son directs expletive-filled accusations at the Hollywood actor for his part in the former president quitting the campaign.

item.title: Trump administration releases FBI records on MLK Jr. despite his family’s opposition
Court overturns guilty verdict in 1979 Etan Patz case that drew attention to missing children
